fem.analysis

Class FirstOrderLinearAnalysis

  • java.lang.Object
    • fem.analysis.FirstOrderLinearAnalysis
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Analysis

    public class FirstOrderLinearAnalysis
extends java.lang.Object
implements Analysis
    In first-order analysis the System matrix is assumed to be constant and unaffected by changes in the geometry of the model. This is the standard assumption of stationary heat flow, plane elastic problems, groundwater seepage, potential flow and electrostatic first-order analysis.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • assembleSystemMatrix

        public void assembleSystemMatrix(FemModel model,
                                 math.linalg.ProfileMatrix mat)
        Assembles the system matrix for the model. The element matrix for each element is selected depending on which type of analysis is chosen.
        Parameters:
        model - model on which analysis is performed
        mat - profile matrix of the system

      • perform

        public void perform(FemModel model,
                    java.io.File inputFile)
        Description copied from interface: Analysis
        This is the algorithm required by all finite element analysis'. This method performs an analysis on the model by setting the system vector, primal vector, dual vector and status vector for the system. Following, the system matrix is composed which is specific to the order of the analysis (i.e. first or second order). The system matrix is then decomposed using Cholesky decomposition and the unknowns in the primal and dual vectors are solved.
        Specified by:
        perform in interface Analysis
        Parameters:
        model - the model on which the analysis is performed
        inputFile - the input file from which the model is developed
